title: Code Raze
description: Codathon will feature a series of coding questions for participants to solve, testing their problem-solving abilities and programming skills across different levels of difficulty. Join us to tackle these challenges and enhance your coding expertise!
rules: Individual Participation: Each participant must compete individually; team submissions are not allowed.
Time Limit: All projects must be submitted by the specified deadline.
Judging Criteria: Projects will be evaluated based on functionality, creativity, design, and overall impact.
Permitted Tools: Participants may use any programming language, framework, or tool of their choice.
Disqualification: Any form of cheating, plagiarism, or unauthorized collaboration will lead to disqualification.

title: Innovathon
description: Participate in a dynamic hackathon, where teams create innovative solutions to real-world challenges. Present your projects to a panel of judges, showcase your skills, and compete for top prizes!
rules: Team Size: Teams can consist of 2-5 participants.
Original Work: All code and project work must be done during the event.
Time Limit: All projects must be submitted before the hackathon deadline.
Permitted Tools : Teams can use any language, frameworks, or tool.
Project Ownership: Teams retain full ownership of their projects.
Disqualification: Any form of cheating or plagiarism will result in immediate disqualification.
Judging Criteria: Projects will be evaluated based on innovation, functionality, design, and impact.
Submission Requirements: Teams must provide a demo or presentation of their project during the final round.
External Resources: Open-source libraries and APIs are allowed, but no pre-existing projects can be submitted.

title: Integration Bee
description: A 24-hour hackathon where participants build innovative projects.
rules: Participants can use any programming language.
Internet access is allowed.
Projects must be submitted before the deadline.

title: Spell Bee
description: Solve clues and find hidden treasures around campus.
rules: No external help is allowed.
Each team must follow the designated route.
Use of mobile phones is prohibited.

title: Survive NIT
description: Compete in popular games like FIFA, Valorant, and BGMI.
rules: Only registered participants can compete.
Players must use their own gaming accounts.
Any form of cheating will lead to disqualification.

title: Pitch IT
description: Showcase your creativity with paintings and sketches.
rules: Participants must bring their own materials.
Artwork should be completed within 2 hours.
Themes will be provided on the spot.

title: 2D/3D Design
description: Capture stunning images based on the given theme.
rules: Only DSLR or mobile cameras are allowed.
Editing is allowed but must be minimal.
Each participant can submit up to 3 images.

title: Robo GP
description: Compete with other musicians and showcase your talent.
rules: Each performance should not exceed 5 minutes.
Only original compositions or covers allowed.
No pre-recorded vocals allowed.

title: Brain Snap
description: A battle of words on relevant social and political topics.
rules: Each speaker gets 3 minutes to present their argument.
Use of offensive language will result in disqualification.
Judges' decision will be final.

title: Treasure Hunt
description: Present your innovative startup ideas to investors and mentors.
rules: Each team gets 10 minutes to pitch their idea.
Presentation must include a business model.
Judges’ decision is final.

title: Stock Race
description: Present your innovative startup ideas to investors and mentors.
rules: Each team gets 10 minutes to pitch their idea.
Presentation must include a business model.
Judges’ decision is final.

title: Circuit X
description: Present your innovative startup ideas to investors and mentors.
rules: Each team gets 10 minutes to pitch their idea.
Presentation must include a business model.
Judges’ decision is final.
